oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Computerized Veterinary Practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Glore, Reilly
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: computers
veterinary practice
production medicine
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper will discuss four main aspects of computers in veterinary practice. First we will explore some common principles and myths about computers in general. Then we will cover the practical issues that relate to computerizing a mixed veterinary practice, and discuss some specific comments on implementing computers into dairy production medicine aspects of your practice. We will finish with some practice tips about using, buying, and educating ourselves about computers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1988; 56-65
